intro: Ophidion compactum, commonly known as the compact bluemink, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, characterized by its aromatic foliage and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its leaves are finely divided and have a bluish-gray hue, while its flowers are white or pale blue. Ophidion compactum is often used in native plant gardens for its ornamental value and ecological benefits.
